entries.content:
Now I have a comprehensive understanding of the codebase. The project uses:
- **Clean Architecture** with DI Container pattern
- **Core Data** with entities already designed (User, BodyRecord, MetabolismSnapshot, DailyLog)
- **SwiftUI** with tab-based navigation

Let me create the implementation plan:

1â†’{
     2â†’  "feature": "Body Composition Tracking with BMR/TDEE",
     3â†’  "description": "# Body Composition Tracking with BMR/TDEE

Complete body composition logging system including height, weight, body fat percentage, muscle mass, with automatic BMR (Mifflin-St Jeor) and TDEE calculations. Visualize changes over time with Swift Charts graphs showing trends and goal progress.

## Rationale
Core differentiator: unified body composition + metabolic tracking that competitors lack. Addresses user pain point of 'hard to see correlations between body composition changes and lifestyle factors'. Better than InBody's unreliable app with 3-22% body fat variation complaints.

## User Stories
- As a fitness enthusiast, I want to track my body fat and muscle mass changes so that I can see my progress
- As a dieter, I want to know my BMR/TDEE so that I can plan my calorie intake accurately
- As a goal-oriented user, I want to visualize my body composition trends so that I stay motivated

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Users can input height, weight, body fat %, muscle mass with validation
- [ ] BMR calculated automatically using Mifflin-St Jeor formula
- [ ] TDEE calculated based on activity level multiplier
- [ ] MetabolismSnapshot saved with each body record for historical tracking
- [ ] Swift Charts displays weight/body fat trends over 7/30/90 days
- [ ] Dashboard shows current BMR/TDEE alongside daily intake/expenditure
- [ ] Performance: queries complete in under 0.5 seconds
",

entries.content:
I've created the implementation plan. Here's a summary:

## Implementation Plan Created

### ğŸ“‹ 8 Phases with 37 Subtasks

| Phase | Name | Subtasks |
|-------|------|----------|
| **1** | Domain Layer - Models & Business Logic | 7 |
| **2** | Data Layer - Repository & Core Data Integration | 5 |
| **3** | Use Cases Layer | 4 |
| **4** | UI Layer - Body Composition Views | 5 |
| **5** | UI Layer - Swift Charts Integration | 6 |
| **6** | Dashboard Integration | 4 |
| **7** | DI Container & Integration | 4 |
| **8** | Testing & Performance | 5 |

### ğŸ¯ Acceptance Criteria Mapped

| AC | Description | Key Subtasks |
|----|-------------|--------------|
| AC-1 | Input validation for body metrics | 1.3, 1.7, 4.1, 4.2 |
| AC-2 | BMR via Mifflin-St Jeor | 1.5, 3.1, 8.1 |
| AC-3 | TDEE with activity multipliers | 1.1, 1.6, 3.1, 8.2 |
| AC-4 | MetabolismSnapshot persistence | 2.3, 3.1 |
| AC-5 | Swift Charts for 7/30/90 day trends | 5.1-5.5 |
| AC-6 | Dashboard BMR/TDEE display | 6.1-6.3 |
| AC-7 | Query performance < 0.5s | 8.5 |

### ğŸ—ï¸ Key Observations from Codebase

- **Core Data schema already includes** `BodyRecord`, `MetabolismSnapshot`, and `User` entities with all required fields
- **Clean Architecture** pattern in place with `DIContainer` for dependency injection
- **Tab-based UI** ready with placeholder views for Dashboard and Body tabs
- **Korean language** comments indicate localized app (UI strings should follow this pattern)

### ğŸ“ Files Created
- `.auto-claude/specs/003-body-composition-tracking-with-bmr-tdee/implementation_plan.json`
- `.auto-claude/specs/003-body-composition-tracking-with-bmr-tdee/build-progress.txt`
I'll help you implement this subtask. Let me start by reading the spec and understanding the codebase structure.

1â†’//
     2â†’//  ActivityLevel.swift
     3â†’//  Bodii
     4â†’//
     5â†’//  Created by Auto-Claude on 2026-01-12.
     6â†’//
     7â†’
     8â†’// ğŸ“š í•™ìŠµ í¬ì¸íŠ¸: Activity Level Enumeration
     9â†’// ì‚¬ìš©ìì˜ í™œë™ ìˆ˜ì¤€ì„ ë‚˜íƒ€ë‚´ëŠ” enum with associated TDEE multipliers
    10â†’// ğŸ’¡ Java ë¹„êµ: enum with propertiesì™€ ìœ ì‚¬í•˜ì§€ë§Œ SwiftëŠ” computed property ì‚¬ìš©
    11â†’
    12â†’import Foundation
    13â†’
    14â†’// MARK: - ActivityLevel
    15â†’
    16â†’/// ì‚¬ìš©ìì˜ ì¼ìƒ í™œë™ ìˆ˜ì¤€
    17â†’/// TDEE(Total Daily Energy Expenditure) ê³„ì‚°ì— ì‚¬ìš©ë˜ëŠ” í™œë™ ê³„ìˆ˜
    18â†’enum ActivityLevel: Int16, CaseIterable, Codable {
    19â†’
    20â†’    // MARK: - Cases
    21â†’
    22â†’    /// ê±°ì˜ ìš´ë™í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠìŒ (ì£¼ë¡œ ì•‰ì•„ì„œ ìƒí™œ)
    23â†’    case sedentary = 0
    24â†’
    25â†’    /// ê°€ë²¼ìš´ í™œë™ (ì£¼ 1-3ì¼ ê°€ë²¼ìš´ ìš´ë™)
    26â†’    case lightlyActive = 1
    27â†’
    28â†’    /// ë³´í†µ í™œë™ (ì£¼ 3-5ì¼ ì¤‘ê°„ ê°•ë„ ìš´ë™)
    29â†’    case moderatelyActive = 2
    30â†’
    31â†’    /// ë§¤ìš° í™œë™ì  (ì£¼ 6-7ì¼ ê°•í•œ ìš´ë™)
    32â†’    case veryActive = 3
    33â†’
    34â†’    /// ê·¹ë„ë¡œ í™œë™ì  (í•˜ë£¨ 2íšŒ ì´ìƒ ë§¤ìš° ê°•í•œ ìš´ë™ ë˜ëŠ” ìœ¡ì²´ ë…¸ë™)
    35â†’    case extraActive = 4
    36â†’
    37â†’    // MARK: - Properties
    38â†’
    39â†’    /// TDEE ê³„ì‚°ì„ ìœ„í•œ í™œë™ ê³„ìˆ˜
    40â†’    /// ğŸ“š í•™ìŠµ í¬ì¸íŠ¸: Computed Property
    41â†’    /// ê° ì¼€ì´ìŠ¤ì— ëŒ€ì‘í•˜ëŠ” multiplier ê°’ì„ ë°˜í™˜
    42â†’    /// ğŸ’¡ Java ë¹„êµ: getter ë©”ì„œë“œì™€ ìœ ì‚¬í•˜ì§€ë§Œ í”„ë¡œí¼í‹°ì²˜ëŸ¼ ì ‘ê·¼
    43â†’    var multiplier: Double {
    44â†’        switch self {
    45â†’        case .sedentary:
    46â†’            return 1.2
    47â†’        case .lightlyActive:
    48â†’            return 1.375
    49â†’        case .moderatelyActive:
    50â†’            return 1.55
    51â†’        case .veryActive:
    52â†’            return 1.725
    53â†’        case .extraActive:
    54â†’            return 1.9
    55â†’        }
    56â†’    }
    57â†’
    58â†’    /// í™œë™ ìˆ˜ì¤€ì˜ í‘œì‹œ ì´ë¦„
    59â†’    /// ğŸ“š í•™ìŠµ í¬ì¸íŠ¸: Localization ê³ ë ¤
    60â†’    /// í–¥í›„ NSLocalizedStringìœ¼ë¡œ êµì²´ ê°€ëŠ¥
    61â†’    var displayName: String {
    62â†’        switch self {
    63â†’        case .sedentary:
    64â†’            return "Sedentary"
    65â†’        case .lightlyActive:
    66â†’            return "Lightly Active"
    67â†’        case .moderatelyActive:
    68â†’            return "Moderately Active"
    69â†’        case .veryActive:
    70â†’            return "Very Active"
    71â†’        case .extraActive:
    72â†’            return "Extra Active"
    73â†’        }
    74â†’    }
    75â†’
    76â†’    /// í™œë™ ìˆ˜ì¤€ì— ëŒ€í•œ ì„¤ëª…
    77â†’    /// ì‚¬ìš©ìê°€ ìì‹ ì˜ í™œë™ ìˆ˜ì¤€ì„ ì„ íƒí•  ë•Œ ì°¸ê³ í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ” ì„¤ëª…
    78â†’    var description: String {
    79â†’        switch self {
    80â†’        case .sedentary:
    81â†’            return "Little or no exercise, desk job"
    82â†’        case .lightlyActive:
    83â†’            return "Light exercise 1-3 days per week"
    84â†’        case .moderatelyActive:
    85â†’            return "Moderate exercise 3-5 days per week"
    86â†’        case .veryActive:
    87â†’            return "Hard exercise 6-7 days per week"
    88â†’        case .extraActive:
    89â†’            return "Very hard exercise twice per day, or physical job"
    90â†’        }
    91â†’    }
    92â†’}
    93â†’
    94â†’// MARK: - Identifiable
    95â†’
    96â†’/// ğŸ“š í•™ìŠµ í¬ì¸íŠ¸: Identifiable Protocol
    97â†’/// SwiftUIì˜ ForEach ë“±ì—ì„œ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ê¸° ìœ„í•œ ê³ ìœ  ì‹ë³„ì ì œê³µ
    98â†’/// ğŸ’¡ Java ë¹„êµ: equals/hashCode ë©”ì„œë“œì™€ ìœ ì‚¬í•œ ì—­í• 
    99â†’extension ActivityLevel: Identifiable {
   100â†’    var id: Int16 {
   101â†’        rawValue
   102â†’    }
   103â†’}
